original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- A SrILankan Airlines said an aircraft returning from Australia had diverted to Mattala due to bad weather in Colombo, and had to remain on ground as crew had reached their flight duty time limits.
Flight UL 605 was returning from Melbourne on May 04, when bad weather stopped aircraft landings in  Colombo.
“There were 294 passengers, 3 infants and 15 crew members onboard UL 605,” the airline said.

“Passengers who were to disembark in Sri Lanka were provided with ground transport to Colombo and passengers travelling beyond Sri Lanka were given hotel accommodation in and around Mattala until the flight’s departure to Bandaranaike International Airport.”
